wikipedia_page.main: Charles Robert Baillie-Hamilton (24 September 1848 – 28 July 1927) was a Scottish civil servant, who became clerk to the Treasury. In his youth, he was a keen sportsman who played for the Scottish side in the first football match against England in March 1870.

link_mentions.page: England v Scotland representative football matches (1870–1872)

response: *Charles R. Baillie-Hamilton (1848–1927), played football for Scotland in 1870
*Charles R. Baillie-Hamilton (1848–1927), Scottish civil servant, who became clerk to the Treasury
